newsitem.title: USA: Advanta up on takeover rumors - analysts.
newsitem.headline: Advanta up on takeover rumors - analysts.

text.p: Shares of Advanta Corp gained about eight percent Wednesday amid renewed rumors that the monoline credit card company is a takeover candidate, analysts said.
Industry analysts, however, had vastly different notions of how much a buyer would be willing to pay for the company.
Advanta was up 2-7/16 to 34-5/16. About 1.8 million shares had changed hands by 1510 EDT/1910 GMT, more than three times Advanta's average daily trading volume.
Advanta declined to comment on the activity in its stock.
"My official view is that I'd be surprised if it (Advanta) went for over $30 a share," said Gary Gordon, an analyst at PaineWebber.

"If the market has a view that it's a takeover target, it can talk (the stock price) up. But that doesn't mean it will necessarily go for that price. I doubt any rational buyer would pay more than $30."
Others put a higher price tag on Advanta shares.

"If the company demonstrates to investors or a potential acquirer that its problems are behind it, it could get as much as $60 a share," said Leslie Nelkin, an analyst with Furman Selz. "If not, it could fetch about $40 a share."
For the first quarter, Advanta posted a loss of $0.43 a share, compared with a profit of $0.91 in the 1996 first quarter.
Advanta's first quarter was hurt by increases in consumer bankruptcies and charge-offs, and lower receivable balances than originally expected in its credit card business.
Analysts said they knew of no specific suitor, but Nelkin said it would make sense for Advanta to combine with another financial institution.
"But it's hard to say if it's this month or six months from now," he said.
In March, Advanta said it had hired BT Wolfensohn to review its business strategy, growth prospects and operating environment.

The Australian Financial Review newspaper recently reported that National Australia Bank Ltd was looking at a possible takeover of Advanta. NAD, Australia's largest bank, declined comment on the report.
Prudential Securities analyst Jennifer Scutti downgraded Advanta today to hold from buy. No details were available.
